We are delighted to provide UVA classes with instructional sessions using the wealth of materials in our Special Collections Library. In order to allow adequate preparation, we require that sessions and materials requests be made at least two weeks ahead of time.

We are conducting both in-person and remote Special Collections sessions during the Spring 2021 semester.

In light of COVID-19â€™s social distancing requirements, a few restrictions are in place:

  • Sessions are limited to classes with a student enrollment of 20 or fewer.
  • In-person sessions will be scheduled based on the pedagogical need to access physical materials, as well as on staff and room availability.
  • Materials handling will be restricted to Special Collections staff unless an exception is granted for faculty handling

We are happy to work with you to create an online session (synchronous or asynchronous) for the following:

  • General introductions to Special Collections.
  • Classes with more than 20 students.
  • Online classes of any size.

Please note: Our operational status is dependent on that of the University. If the decision is made to move classes online, we may need to adjust our services.

If you have any questions or need assistance, please email Krystal Appiah, our Instruction Librarian for Special Collections, at ka7uz@virginia.edu.
